intro: Styphelia sonderensis, commonly known as the Sonder's snowbell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. Styphelia sonderensis is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to cool, humid climates.
